snippet: The authorities say the International Criminal Court lawyer and staff members will not be released until they explain their dealings with Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, whom they visited in Libya.
abstract: Libyan authorities who are detaining Melinda Taylor, a lawyer from the International Criminal Court and her three associates, say they will not be released until the lawyer answers questions about her dealings with Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, a son of former dictator Col Muammar el-Qaddafi;
lead_paragraph: The authorities say the International Criminal Court lawyer and staff members will not be released until they explain their dealings with Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, whom they visited in Libya.

headline.seo: International Criminal Court Workers Held in Libya
headline.main: Libya Refuses to Release Hague Court Workers
headline.print_headline: Libya Refuses To Release Hague Staff In Custody

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
